1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
a man in general (singly or collectively)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

3.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand

4.brief: the heart (as the most interior organ);
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, to be dense, i.e. tough or severe (in various applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)

5.brief: to remove (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to grow old; specifically, to transcribe
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

6.brief: to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform
properly, perhaps to rend, i.e. (by implication) to quiver

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
to close up; especially to seal

8.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

9.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the constellation of the Great Bear (perhaps from its migration through the heavens)
any notable constellation; specifically Orion (as if a burly one)
a cluster of stars, i.e. the Pleiades
the south (as being on the right hand of a person facing the east)

10.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

near, with or among; often in general, to

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

to surround, i.e. protect or aid

adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

16.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen

17.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to gape, i.e. snap at; figuratively, to overwhelm
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

to knot or distort; figuratively, to pervert (act or declare perverse)
